subject: Education
title: MOOCs: Massive Ambition, Mixed Results
description: A quick win: understand MOOCs: Massive Ambition, Mixed Results.

hook.text: In 2012, Stanford's free AI course enrolled 160,000 students. Only 23,000 finished.

buildup.text: MOOCs promised to democratize elite educationâ€”free courses from Harvard, MIT, and Stanford for all.

discovery.text: They succeeded in access: millions worldwide gained exposure to world-class instruction.

twist.text: Completion rates hover around 5-10%, and most learners already hold degrees.

climax.text: MOOCs evolved into paid certificate programs, drifting from their original free-education mission.

punchline.text: Free access doesn't mean equal outcomes. Motivation costs more than tuition.

quiz.question: What is a major challenge facing MOOCs?
options: Very low completion rates, typically around 5-10%
Courses are too short to cover any material
Universities refuse to participate in MOOC platforms
